intro: Leontodon autumnalis var. coronopifolius, commonly known as the autumn leontodon, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open woodland and meadows, preferring moist, well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a rough texture, while the flowers are yellow with a central disk. This variety is distinguished by its distinctive leaf shape, which resembles a crown, giving it its scientific name.
